zh: 请关上窗户。

en: Would you mind if I shut the window? I have a slight cold.
zh: 我能关下窗户吗？我有点感冒了。

en: Close the window, will you?
zh: 帮我关下窗户好吗？

en: Would you mind closing the window?
zh: 你介意关下窗户吗？

en: Keep the window closed.
zh: 别开窗户。

en: Close the window.
zh: 把窗户关上。

en: Shut the windows and keep that cold wind out.
zh: 把窗户关严实点，别让冷风吹进来。

en: You had better close the window.
zh: 你最好把窗户关了。

en: After I cleaned the window, I could see through it clearly.
zh: 擦完窗户后，外面看得可清楚了。

en: After cleaning the windows, there always seems to be a visible trace of dirt.
zh: 窗户怎么擦好像都有点印儿。

en: A hammer was used to break the window.
zh: 窗户是用锤子砸破的。

en: Don't punish him for breaking the window. He is not to blame.
zh: 别因为打碎窗户惩罚他，这不怪他。

en: Don't open the window.
zh: 别开窗。

en: Do you want me to open the window?
zh: 要我把窗户打开吗？

en: Let's open the window.
zh: 咱们把窗户打开吧。

en: Open the window.
zh: 把窗户打开。

en: Open the window and let some fresh air into the room, please.
zh: 请把窗户打开，让屋里透透气。

en: Open the windows to let in some air.
zh: 把窗户打开换换气。

en: Do you mind opening the window?
zh: 你介意开下窗吗？

en: Open the window, will you?
zh: 把窗户开一下好吗？

en: Do you mind if I open the window and let the smoke out?
zh: 我开窗散散烟，你介意吗？

en: Could you open the window?
zh: 能帮我开下窗吗？

en: Do you mind if I open the window?
zh: 我开下窗户你介意吗？

en: Will you open the window and air out this stuffy room?
zh: 能开下窗吗？这屋里太闷了，透透气。

en: Open the window. It's baking hot in here.
zh: 把窗户打开，屋里太热了。

en: Please open the window.
zh: 请开下窗。

en: Open the window and let in some fresh air.
zh: 开下窗户，透透新鲜空气。

en: Don't leave the windows open.
zh: 别开着窗户。

en: Don't sleep with the windows open.
zh: 别开着窗睡觉。

en: Don't leave the room with the window open.
zh: 离开房间时别开着窗。

en: Please keep the windows open.
zh: 请一直开着窗户。

en: Was it Jack that broke the window?
zh: 窗户是杰克打破的吗？

en: When I opened the window, I saw children playing baseball.
zh: 我打开窗户的时候，看见孩子们在打棒球。

en: Would you please shut the window?
zh: 能麻烦你关下窗吗？

en: Shall I close the window?
zh: 要我关窗吗？

en: Didn't it occur to you to shut the windows?
zh: 你就没想过要关窗户吗？

en: Did it not occur to you to close the windows?
zh: 你就没想过要把窗户关上吗？

en: May I ask you to close the window?
zh: 能请你关下窗吗？

en: Would you mind my opening the window?
zh: 我开窗你介意吗？

en: Can I open the window?
zh: 我可以开窗吗？

en: May I open the windows?
zh: 我能开窗吗？

en: May I open the window?
zh: 我能开下窗吗？

en: Don't leave the window open.
zh: 别一直开着窗。

en: Both of the windows were broken.
zh: 两扇窗户都破了。

en: Her windows were broken and her shutters hung crookedly.
zh: 她的窗户破了，百叶窗也歪歪斜斜地挂着。

en: I looked in the direction of the window, but didn't see anything.
zh: 我往窗户那边看，但什么也没看到。

en: They charged me for the broken window.
zh: 他们因为窗户破了管我要钱。

en: I saw a man's face inside the window.
zh: 我看见窗户里有一张男人的脸。

en: Is there a desk by the window?
zh: 窗边有桌子吗？

en: Looking out of the window, I saw a rainbow.
zh: 往窗外看，我看到了一道彩虹。

en: Looking out the window, I saw a car coming.
zh: 往窗外看，我看见一辆车开过来了。

en: Looking out of the window, I saw a stranger at the doorstep.
zh: 往窗外看，我看见门口有个陌生人。

en: Look out of the window.
zh: 往窗外看。

en: The noise outside his window prevented him from sleeping.
zh: 窗外的噪音吵得他睡不着。

en: He couldn't sleep because of the noise outside his window.
zh: 因为窗外太吵，他睡不着觉。

en: I heard someone shout outside the window.
zh: 我听见窗外有人在喊。

en: Do you know the girl standing by the window?
zh: 你认识站在窗边那个女孩吗？

en: I wanted to meet and talk with the girl at the window.
zh: 我想见见那个在窗边的女孩，跟她聊聊。

en: I saw a man's face in the window.
zh: 我在窗户里看到一个男人的脸。

en: There was a light burning in the window.
zh: 窗户那儿亮着灯。

en: There were curtains hanging over the window.
zh: 窗户上挂着窗帘。

en: See that the window is closed.
zh: 去看看窗户关好没。

en: The morning sun came in the window.
zh: 晨光从窗户洒了进来。

en: Don't put your hands out the window.
zh: 手别伸出窗外。

en: Don't put your hand out the window.
zh: 别把手伸到窗户外面。

en: Don't stick your hand out of the window.
zh: 别把手伸出窗外。

en: You'll see a lot of high mountains through the window.
zh: 从窗户往外看能看到很多高山。

en: The high building can be seen from the window.
zh: 从窗户这儿能看到那栋高楼。

en: Don't put your head out of the window.
zh: 别把头伸出窗外。

en: A face appeared at the window.
zh: 窗户那儿露出一张脸。

en: Don't look out the window. Concentrate on your work.
zh: 别往窗外看了，专心干活。

en: Don't look out the window, focus on your studies.
zh: 别往窗外看，专心学习。

en: Do not look out of the window.
zh: 别往窗外看。

en: Don't look out of the window.
zh: 别往窗外看。

en: Don't look out the window.
zh: 别往窗外看。

en: Do not look out the window.
zh: 别往窗外看。

en: We have a good view of the sea from the window.
zh: 从窗户看出去海景很美。

en: A beam of light through the window woke the professor up out of a deep sleep.
zh: 一束光穿过窗户，把熟睡的教授弄醒了。

en: Show me the stone that broke the window.
zh: 给我看看那块砸碎窗户的石头。

en: Who's the naughty boy that broke the window?
zh: 哪个调皮鬼砸了窗户？

en: With the window broken, we could not keep the room warm.
zh: 窗户碎了，屋里根本暖和不起来。

en: Have you ever watched sumo wrestling?
zh: 你看过相扑吗？

en: Sumo is the traditional sport of Japan.
zh: 相扑是日本的传统运动。

en: Sumo wrestling is a traditional Japanese sport.
zh: 相扑是日本的一种传统运动。

en: Sumo is a traditional Japanese sport.
zh: 相扑是日本的传统运动。

en: Sumo is great fun; otherwise she wouldn't be interested in it.
zh: 相扑挺有意思的，不然她才不会感兴趣呢。

en: The important point concerning the complementary distribution is to specify the environment where the individual sounds occur.
zh: 互补分布的要点在于明确每个音出现的具体环境。

en: I'm as busy as ever.
zh: 我还跟以前一样忙。

en: Same as usual.
zh: 还是老样子。

en: You are at it again.
zh: 你又来了。

en: I see you're at it again.
zh: 我看你又开始了。

en: You never change, do you?
zh: 你还是一点儿没变。

en: When two powerful forces with opposite ideals come face to face, it's time for a showdown.
zh: 当两股理念相反的强大势力碰头时，就该决战了。

en: He is well advanced in life.
zh: 他已经上了岁数了。

en: Unless you have good credit, buying a house is impossible.
zh: 除非你信用好，否则没法买房。

en: We thought we might expect a good harvest.
zh: 我们觉得今年的收成应该不错。

en: Please come to talk to me.
zh: 请过来跟我谈谈。

en: Put our heads together.
zh: 咱们一起合计合计。

en: Few scientists understand the theory of relativity.
zh: 没几个科学家懂相对论。

en: The theory of relativity originated with Einstein.
zh: 相对论是爱因斯坦提出的。

en: May I share this table with you?
zh: 我能拼个桌吗？

en: Some speculators take advantage of the ignorance and helplessness of old people.
zh: 有些投机分子专门利用老人的无知和无助。

en: People sharing a ride should refrain from conversation with other passengers.
zh: 拼车的人最好别跟其他乘客搭讪。

en: What does the other party want?
zh: 对方想要什么？

en: Your party is on line.
zh: 你要找的人在线上。

en: We determine our attitude on the basis of the other party.
zh: 我们的态度取决于对方。

en: You must be deliberate in selecting a partner.
zh: 选搭档一定要慎重。

en: Is that the way you talk to me?
zh: 你就这么跟我说话？

en: They want to choose their mates by their own will.
zh: 他们想自己挑对象。

en: There was a short silence on the other end.
zh: 电话那头沉默了一会儿。

en: It's four against you. You'll be beaten up.
zh: 四个打你一个，你会被揍得很惨。

en: Here's your party.
zh: 接通了。

en: In order to distract the others, we brought up this irrelevant issue as a red herring.
zh: 为了分散注意力，我们提了这个无关的话题来转移视线。

en: I want you to stop preying on people's weaknesses.
zh: 我希望你别再利用别人的弱点了。

en: We thought it wrong not to listen to our opponents.
zh: 我们觉得不听对手的意见是不对的。

en: Don't say bad things about others behind their backs.
zh: 别在背后说人家坏话。

en: You need to show a genuine interest in the other person.
zh: 你得对人家表现出真心的兴趣。

en: He keeps on talking forever if you listen to him.
zh: 你要是听他讲，他能没完没了地唠叨下去。

en: Beating the other team was no sweat at all.
zh: 赢对方球队简直是不费吹灰之力。

en: The other team tried to keep them from crossing the line.
zh: 对方球队想拦住他们，不让他们过线。

en: The players had to throw the ball from one to another to try to get the ball over the other team's baseline.
zh: 球员们得互相传球，想办法把球带过对方底线。

en: We tied with the other team for first place.
zh: 我们和对方球队并列第一。

en: The opposing team did not put up much of a fight, so we won hands down.
zh: 对手根本没怎么反抗，我们轻轻松松就赢了。

en: I long for company.
zh: 我想找个伴儿。

en: I want a friend.
zh: 我想交个朋友。

en: She beat me. I had underestimated the power of a woman.
zh: 她赢了我。我低估了女人的力量。

en: If the other person does mention his family, then it is perfectly OK to ask about the ages of the children, and if you have children, to compare educational and cultural differences in raising children.
zh: 要是对方提到了家人，那问问孩子几岁了完全没问题；要是你也有孩子，还可以聊聊育儿方面的文化差异。

en: Despite their own scandals, the police continue to make arrests as though nothing had happened at all.
zh: 尽管警方自己丑闻缠身，但他们还是像没事人一样继续抓人。

en: Mutual understanding promotes peace.
zh: 相互理解促进和平。

en: Mutual understanding makes for peace.
zh: 相互理解有助于和平。

en: What will become of our close relations if the bilateral security treaty expires?
zh: 如果双边安全条约到期了，我们的亲密关系会变成什么样？

en: In order to lose weight you had better take up some sport.
zh: 为了减肥，你最好找个运动项目练起来。

en: If you want to become thin, you should cut back on the between-meal snacks.
zh: 你要是想变瘦，就得少吃点零食。

en: The dispute was settled peacefully.
zh: 争端得到了和平解决。

en: And though a web looks complicated, it takes a spider little time to make one and catch insects.
zh: 虽然蜘蛛网看着复杂，但蜘蛛没一会儿就能织好并抓到虫子。

en: Although the web looks soft and delicate, it is strong.
zh: 虽然蜘蛛网看着又细又软，其实结实得很。

en: Sooner or later, she will appear.
zh: 她迟早会出现的。

en: Sooner or later, he will run out of luck.
zh: 他的好运迟早会用光的。

en: Sooner or later, we'll have to tackle the problem in earnest.
zh: 我们迟早得认真处理这个问题。

en: Quick at meal, quick at work.
zh: 吃饭快，干活也快。

en: It is nice to take a walk early in the morning.
zh: 一大早去散散步挺舒服的。

en: The dew falls in early morning.
zh: 清晨会有露水。

en: It's been raining since early morning.
zh: 从一大早就开始下雨了。

en: Anyway, to get to what I wanted to ask you...it's about the party. Are you free Friday?
zh: 话说回来，我想问你的事跟派对有关。你周五有空吗？

en: Please accept our apologies for not filling your order sooner.
zh: 没能尽早处理您的订单，我们深表歉意。

en: He walked quickly away with two dogs trotting at his heels.
zh: 他快步走开了，身后跟着两只一路小跑的狗。

en: Mr Hayakawa was respected by him.
zh: 他很敬重早川先生。

en: If you keep early hours, you may always be fresh as a daisy in the morning.
zh: 你要是早睡早起，早上精神头儿准保特别足。

en: Those who keeps early hour will live long.
zh: 早睡早起的人长寿。

en: People who go to bed early and get up early live a long time.
zh: 早睡早起的人活得久。

en: To keep early hours makes you healthy.
zh: 早睡早起对身体好。

en: Early to bed, early to rise.
zh: 早睡早起。

en: You should keep early hours.
zh: 你应该早睡早起。

en: Unless you keep early hours, you will injure your health.
zh: 你要是不早睡早起，身体会垮掉的。

en: To keep early hours will do you much good.
zh: 早睡早起对你很有好处。

en: To keep early hours is fundamental to good health.
zh: 早睡早起是健康之本。

en: Keeping early hours is good for the health.
zh: 早睡早起有益健康。

en: Early to bed, early to rise makes a man healthy, wealthy and wise.
zh: 早睡早起让人健康、富有又聪明。

en: I'm used to keeping early hours.
zh: 我习惯了早睡早起。

en: One who keeps good hours will live long.
zh: 作息规律的人活得长。

en: Those who keep early hours are generally healthy.
zh: 早睡早起的人通常身体都挺好。

en: We all know that it's better to keep early hours.
zh: 我们都知道早睡早起比较好。

en: Soon ripe, soon rotten.
zh: 熟得早，烂得快。

en: All the early flowers were bitten by the frost.
zh: 早开的花全被霜给冻坏了。

en: Soon learnt, soon forgotten.
zh: 学得快，忘得也快。

en: Don't jump to conclusions.
zh: 别急着下结论。

en: You must take action for their release quickly.
zh: 你得赶紧行动让他们获释。

en: Prompt action is necessary.
zh: 得赶紧行动。

en: It's necessary to discuss the problem without delay.
zh: 咱们得赶紧讨论一下这个问题。

en: I believe in early rising.
zh: 我觉得早起挺好的。

en: I believe in getting up early.
zh: 我觉得早起很有必要。

en: It was his habit to rise early.
zh: 他习惯早起。

en: He was in the habit of getting up early.
zh: 他有早起的习惯。

en: It was his habit to get up early.
zh: 他以前习惯早起。

en: Early rising is with him a matter of course.
zh: 对他来说，早起是理所当然的事。

en: It is good for the health to get up early.
zh: 早起对身体有好处。

en: Early rising is good for the health.
zh: 早起有益健康。

en: I believe in rising early.
zh: 我主张早起。

en: It is good to get up early.
zh: 早起挺好的。

en: Getting up early is very good.
zh: 早起非常有好处。

en: The early bird gets the worm.
zh: 早起的鸟儿有虫吃。

en: You should cultivate the habit of getting up early.
zh: 你得养成早起的习惯。

en: It is impossible to exaggerate the importance of the habit of early rising.
zh: 养成早起习惯的重要性，怎么强调都不为过。

en: I'm used to getting up early.
zh: 我习惯早起了。

en: Get up early, and you'll be in time.
zh: 早点起就赶得上了。

en: If you get up early, you will feel so much the better.
zh: 要是能早起，你会觉得精神好得多。

en: Get up early, or you'll be late.
zh: 早点起，不然就迟到了。

en: His last lecture at Waseda brought down the house.
zh: 他在早稻田的最后一场讲座博得了满堂彩。

en: He who laughs last laughs best.
zh: 谁笑到最后，谁笑得最好。

en: Come quick!
zh: 快点过来！

en: Come quickly!
zh: 赶紧过来！

en: Get ready quickly.
zh: 快点准备。

en: I can't walk fast, but I can walk for a long time.
zh: 我走不快，但我能走很久。

en: You've arrived too early.
zh: 你来得太早了。

en: I go to bed early so I can get up to capture the sunrise.
zh: 我早点睡，好早起拍日出。

en: I suggested that we should start early.
zh: 我建议咱们早点出发。

en: We agreed on an early start.
zh: 我们商定早点动身。

en: Let's start early, shall we?
zh: 咱们早点出发吧？

en: Let's leave early.
zh: 咱们早点走吧。

en: Would it be better to start early?
zh: 早点出发会不会好一点？

en: You have only to leave early to get a good seat.
zh: 你只要早点走就能占个好位子。

en: I hope you'll recover quickly.
zh: 希望你早日康复。

en: If we begin early, we can finish by lunch.
zh: 要是咱们早点开始，午饭前就能干完。

en: Sooner begun, sooner done.
zh: 早点开始，早点完事。

en: Get up early.
zh: 早点起床。

en: I hope you'll make up your mind quickly.
zh: 我希望你快点做决定。

en: You had better get up early.
zh: 你最好早点起。

en: You should get up early.
zh: 你该早点起。

en: You'd better get up early.
zh: 你最好早点起。

en: If you get up early, you can be in time for school.
zh: 要是早点起，你上学就来得及。

en: Get up early, else you'll be late for school.
zh: 早点起，不然上学要迟到了。

en: Remind him to come home early.
zh: 提醒他早点回家。

en: You had best go home early.
zh: 你最好早点回家。

en: You should go home early.
zh: 你应该早点回家。

en: Go home quickly.
zh: 快点回家。

en: Come home early, Bill.
zh: 比尔，早点回家。

en: Come home early.
zh: 早点回来。

en: You may go as long as you come home early.
zh: 只要你能早点回来，你就可以去。

en: If you come back soon, you may go.
zh: 要是你能快点回来，就可以去。

en: You can go out, as long as you promise to be back early.
zh: 你可以出去，只要你答应早点回来。

en: Come here soon.
zh: 快点到这儿来。

en: I wrote him a letter and asked him to return home soon.
zh: 我给他写了封信，让他快点回家。

en: I wrote him a letter asking him to come home soon.
zh: 我写信让他早点回来。

en: I hope you get well soon.
zh: 希望你快点好起来。

en: I'm sorry I couldn't write to you sooner.
zh: 抱歉没能早点给你写信。

en: Make with the beers, I'm thirsty!
zh: 快拿啤酒来，渴死我了！

en: Be quick! We haven't much time.
zh: 快点！我们没多少时间了。

en: It was her fate to die young.
zh: 她命不好，年纪轻轻就去世了。

en: I hope you will answer soon.
zh: 希望能早点收到你的回信。

en: Why don't you have your bath now?
zh: 你怎么现在还不去洗澡？

en: Take a shower, now!
zh: 赶紧去洗澡！

en: You are early.
zh: 你来得真早。

en: First come, first served.
zh: 先到先得。

en: To cut a long story short, he was fired.
zh: 长话短说，他被开除了。

en: Puppets work with wires.
zh: 木偶是靠线操纵的。

en: The puppets are controlled by wires.
zh: 那些木偶是用线拉着的。

en: May I use the vacuum cleaner?
zh: 我能用一下吸尘器吗？

en: The search party found him lying at the foot of a cliff.
zh: 搜救队在悬崖下找到了躺在那儿的他。

en: Investigators uncovered an assassination plot.
zh: 调查人员发现了一桩暗杀阴谋。

en: I don't want the investigation to burn out.

en: I found what I was looking for.

en: I used my imagination.

en: Imagination is the root of all civilization.

en: I couldn't even guess.

en: When is the pep rally?

zh: 我在仓敷期间，三宅先生带我去了很多地方。

en: Who was it that forgot to lock the door of the warehouse?

en: The warehouse was empty except for a piece of furniture.
zh: 仓库里除了件家具，什么都没有。

en: You cannot learn the truth unless you hear what both parties have to say.
zh: 不听听双方的说法，你就没法了解真相。

en: It was a long war because neither side would give in.
zh: 这是一场持久战，因为双方都不肯让步。

en: Both sides had to compromise with each other.
zh: 双方都不得不互相妥协。

en: It is sometimes difficult to tell twins apart.
zh: 有时候很难分清双胞胎谁是谁。

en: The Brown twins, both of whom got recently married, held a party.
zh: 布朗家那对最近刚结婚的双胞胎办了个派对。

en: You must exercise your imagination.
zh: 你得动动你的想象力。

en: Rats desert a sinking ship.
zh: 船要沉了，老鼠都会先跑。

en: The lawsuit remains undecided.
zh: 官司还没判下来。

en: With the money Jack won from his lawsuit, he should be able to live on easy street.
zh: 靠着官司赢来的钱，杰克应该能过上舒坦日子了。

en: In the "Mafia" tradition of organized crime, any member who discloses its operation is sure to be rubbed out.
zh: 在黑手党这种组织里，泄密的成员肯定会被干掉。

en: From the viewpoint of tissue culture, the environment for this experiment should be more rigidly defined.
zh: 从组织培养的角度来看，这个实验的环境要求应该更严格一些。

en: The union members were up in arms.

en: The union went out on a strike for an indefinite period.

en: The union bargained with the management.
zh: 工会和管理层进行了谈判。

en: Did the union participate in the demonstration?
zh: 工会参加游行了吗？

en: The union won a 5% wage increase.
zh: 工会争取到了5%的加薪。

en: The union is pressing for a ten-percent pay hike.
zh: 工会正在争取加薪10%。

en: The leaders of the Union agitated for higher wages.
zh: 工会领导在那儿鼓动要加薪。

en: It is improper to impose sanctions upon the union.
zh: 对工会实施制裁不太合适。

en: The union and the company have come to terms on a new contract.
zh: 工会和公司已经谈妥了新合同。

en: Forming a cabinet is difficult.
zh: 组阁可真不容易。

en: A nice room, isn't it?
zh: 这房间真不错，是吧？

en: Those are nice gloves you have on.
zh: 你戴的这副手套真好看。

en: What a nice car you have! You must have paid a lot for it.
zh: 你的车真棒！肯定花了不少钱吧。

en: What a nice car you have! You must've paid a lot for it.
zh: 你的车太漂亮了！肯定挺贵的。

en: You have done a wonderful job.
zh: 你干得太出色了。

en: Have a nice holiday.
zh: 祝你假期愉快。

en: We had a glorious time.
zh: 我们玩得开心极了。

en: That's a nice tie you're wearing.
zh: 你系的这条领带挺好看的。

en: I found a nice cup.

en: Thank you for sending me a nice card.
zh: 谢谢你给我寄了这么漂亮的卡片。

en: Frankly speaking, you made a mistake.
zh: 坦白说，你犯了个错误。

en: Frankly speaking, he is untrustworthy.
zh: 说实话，他这人不可靠。

en: A fast child may win the race, but even a slow child can compete.
zh: 跑得快的孩子能赢，但跑得慢的孩子也能参加比赛呀。

en: Anxious for a quick decision, the chairman called for a vote.
zh: 主席急着想定下来，就提议投票了。

en: The United States is a paradise for almost every kind of sports, thanks to its wonderfully varied climate.
zh: 多亏了多样的气候，美国简直是各种运动的天堂。

en: All the best wishes on this wonderful day.
zh: 在这美好的日子里，祝你一切顺心。

en: Isn't this weather just great!
zh: 这天气也太好了吧！

en: Lovely day, isn't it?

en: Hope you'll have a wonderful birthday.
zh: 祝你过一个开心的生日。

en: A wonderful idea occurred to me.
zh: 我突然想到了一个绝妙的主意。

en: A wonderful idea just ran through my mind.
zh: 我脑子里刚才闪过一个超棒的主意。

en: Kudos for your outstanding achievement!
zh: 为你取得的杰出成就点赞！

en: I hope you'll have a great year.
zh: 希望你这一年都过得顺顺利利的。

en: Ah, wonderful.
zh: 啊，太好了。

en: Marvellous.
zh: 太棒了。

en: Wonderful.
zh: 真不错。

en: Takuya swam naked as a jaybird.
zh: 拓哉光着屁股在游泳。

en: This is just a small gift, but please accept it.
zh: 这点儿小意思，请收下。

en: My grandmother has got old.
zh: 我奶奶老了。

en: My grandma has gotten very old.
zh: 我奶奶已经很老了。

en: My grandmother has become old.
zh: 我奶奶年纪大了。

en: Grandmother is bent double with age.
zh: 奶奶年纪大了，腰弯得厉害。

en: My grandmother likes traveling by train.
zh: 我奶奶喜欢坐火车旅行。

en: My grandmother was pulling up weeds in her backyard.
zh: 我奶奶在后院拔草呢。

en: My grandmother wears a dress to rags.
zh: 我奶奶一件衣服都要穿到破破烂烂为止。

en: My grandmother left us a great fortune.
zh: 我奶奶给我们留了一大笔遗产。

en: My aunt lives in a lonely house in the country.
zh: 我阿姨住在乡下一栋偏僻的房子里。

en: Grandmother mows the grass in the garden.
zh: 奶奶在花园里除草。

en: My grandmother lives in the country.
zh: 我奶奶住在乡下。

en: My grandmother became sick last week.
zh: 我奶奶上周生病了。

en: My grandmother never changed her style of living.
zh: 我奶奶的生活方式从来没变过。

en: My grandmother is hard of hearing. In other words she is slightly deaf.
zh: 我奶奶耳朵不太好使，换句话说，她有点耳背。

en: My grandmother walks faster than me, and plays tennis better than I do.
zh: 我奶奶走路比我快，网球打得也比我好。

en: My grandmother made me a new dress.
zh: 我奶奶给我做了一件新裙子。

en: Grandmother sent us a box of apples.
zh: 奶奶给我们寄了一箱苹果。

en: My grandmother told me the story of Cinderella.
zh: 我奶奶给我讲了灰姑娘的故事。

en: My grandmother passed away peacefully last night.
zh: 我奶奶昨晚安详地走了。

en: My grandmother had been sick for a week when I visited her.
zh: 我去看奶奶的时候，她已经病了一个星期了。

en: My grandmother is very forgetful of things nowadays.
zh: 我奶奶现在记性特别差，老是忘事。

en: Grandmother believes that Chinese medicines are the best.
zh: 奶奶觉得中药是最好的。

en: My grandmother speaks slowly.
zh: 我奶奶说话慢吞吞的。

en: My grandmother used to go out for a walk almost every day, but now she seldom, if ever, goes out.
zh: 我奶奶以前几乎每天都出去散步，但现在很少出门，甚至根本不出门了。

en: My grandmother can only eat soft food.
zh: 我奶奶只能吃点软烂的东西。

en: Grandmother carried the table by herself.
zh: 奶奶一个人搬了那张桌子。

en: Grandmother looked very well.
zh: 奶奶看着气色挺好的。

en: My grandmother was gradually becoming forgetful and frail.
zh: 我奶奶渐渐变得容易忘事，身体也虚弱了。

en: My grandmother went peacefully in the night.
zh: 我奶奶昨晚在睡梦中安详地走了。

en: My grandmother is the oldest in this town.
zh: 我奶奶是这镇上年纪最大的。

en: My grandmother is always complaining of the cold.
zh: 我奶奶老是喊冷。

en: My grandmother can't see very well.
zh: 我奶奶眼睛不太好使了。

en: My grandmother lived to be ninety-five years old.
zh: 我奶奶活到了九十五岁。

en: Grandma is three and a half times your age.
zh: 奶奶的岁数是你的三倍半。

en: My grandmother's old watch has been lying in the drawer for years.
zh: 我奶奶那块旧表在抽屉里放了好些年了。

en: Grandmother makes a practice of keeping early hours.
zh: 奶奶一直保持着早睡早起的好习惯。

en: In my grandmother's lifetime, both telephones and computers have become commonplace.
zh: 在我奶奶这辈子，电话和电脑都普及了。

en: My grandmother paid my way to Boston.
zh: 我去波士顿的钱是我奶奶出的。

en: Our grandparents would come to see us on the weekends.
zh: 我爷爷奶奶以前周末会来看我们。

en: My grandfather goes for a walk every day.
zh: 我爷爷每天都去散步。

en: My grandfather does moderate exercise every morning, which is why he is strong and healthy.
zh: 我爷爷每天早上都做适度运动，所以身体挺硬朗。

en: My grandfather is very healthy.
zh: 我爷爷身体特别好。

en: Grandfather has retired because he is getting old.

en: My grandfather has retired because he's grown old.
zh: 我爷爷因为年纪大了就退休了。

en: Grandfather is still very active for his age.
zh: 以爷爷这个年纪来说，他身体还算挺利索的。

en: Because of his age, my grandfather doesn't hear well.

en: My grandfather comes from Osaka.
zh: 我爷爷是大阪人。

en: My grandfather is from Osaka.

en: My grandfather keeps early hours.

en: My grandfather was wounded in the war.

en: My grandfather has snowy white hair.

en: My grandfather tells us about old things.

en: My grandfather wants to live quietly for the rest of his life.
zh: 我爷爷想安安静静地过完余生。

en: My grandfather died shortly after my birth.

en: My grandfather gave me a birthday present.
zh: 我爷爷送了我一份生日礼物。

en: My grandfather nodded and smiled at me.
zh: 我爷爷对我点点头，笑了笑。

en: Grandfather nodded toward me.
zh: 爷爷朝我点了点头。

en: My grandfather still endeavors to absorb new ideas.
zh: 我爷爷还在努力接触新事物。

en: My grandfather has lived in Kyoto for over 50 years, so he knows his way about.
zh: 我爷爷在京都住了五十多年，对那一带熟得很。

en: My grandfather often nods over his newspaper.
zh: 我爷爷看报纸的时候经常打瞌睡。

en: My grandfather used to make furniture for himself.
zh: 我爷爷以前常自己动手做家具。

en: My grandfather would often read and study at this desk.

en: My grandfather is still sound in mind and body.

en: My grandfather sometimes talks to himself when he's alone.

en: Grandfather is napping on the sofa.
zh: 爷爷在沙发上打盹呢。

en: My grandfather cannot walk without a stick.
zh: 我爷爷不拄拐棍就没法走路。

en: My grandfather was always grumbling about something or other.

en: My grandfather always sits in this chair.
zh: 我爷爷总是坐在这把椅子上。

en: My grandfather lived to be ninety-nine years old.

en: My grandfather is in his nineties.

en: My grandfather is 90 years old and very lively.

en: My grandfather died of a disease at eighty.

en: My grandfather is over eighty years old, but he is a good walker.

en: My grandfather died five years ago.
zh: 我爷爷五年前去世了。

en: My grandfather likes looking at colorful carp in the pond on a fine day.
zh: 天气好的时候，我爷爷喜欢看池塘里的锦鲤。

en: My grandfather is planning to retire the year after next.
zh: 我爷爷打算后年退休。

en: We named him Thomas after his grandfather.
zh: 我们随他爷爷的名字，给他起名叫托马斯。

en: My grandfather has made me what I am.
zh: 是我爷爷成就了今天的我。

en: It is ten years since my grandfather died.
zh: 我爷爷已经去世十年了。

en: It's been ten years since my grandfather died.
zh: 我爷爷去世已经有十年了。

en: After the initial shock of hearing of her grandfather's death, the girl started to cry.
zh: 听到爷爷去世的消息，女孩先是愣住了，紧接着就哭了出来。

en: My grandfather made the company what it is today.

en: My grandfather passed away three years ago.
zh: 我爷爷三年前去世了。

en: The flag of his fatherland brought tears to his eyes.
zh: 看到祖国的国旗，他眼眶都湿润了。

en: She will write to me as soon as she returns to her country.
zh: 她一回国就会给我写信。

en: My family came to live in Tokyo in my great-grandfather's time.
zh: 我们家从我太爷爷那时候起就住在东京了。

en: What? A little soup and celery is all I get? I'm not a Zen monk. I can't survive on an austerity diet like this.
zh: 什么？就给这点汤和芹菜？我又不是禅僧，吃这么清淡哪受得了啊。

en: They say Zen cultivates our mind.
zh: 听说禅修能修身养性。

en: They say that Zen strengthens our mind.
zh: 听说禅修能磨练心志。

en: I will do my best.
zh: 我会尽力的。

en: I did the job to the best of my ability.
zh: 这份工作我已经尽我所能了。

en: Rest assured that I will do my best.
zh: 放心吧，我会全力以赴的。

en: I'll do my best.
zh: 我会尽力的。

en: I'll try to explain it to the best of my ability.

en: If you put your best foot forward, you will succeed.
zh: 只要你全力以赴，就一定会成功。

en: Fight with all your might.
zh: 拼尽全力去战斗吧。

en: Give it all you've got.
zh: 全力以赴。

en: Shoot your wad.
zh: 豁出去了。

en: To understand all is to forgive all.
zh: 理解了一切，也就原谅了一切。

en: Eat everything.
zh: 把东西都吃光。

en: You can't have dessert until you finish your meal.
zh: 没吃完饭不能吃甜点。

en: They are all my personal belongings.
zh: 这些全是我的私人物品。

en: Put everything in my basket.
zh: 把所有东西都放进我的篮子里。

en: The whole audience got up and started to applaud.
zh: 全场观众都站起来鼓掌。

en: Could you put all of them in a large bag?
zh: 能把这些全部装进一个大袋子里吗？

en: I like him best of all the teachers.
zh: 所有老师里我最喜欢他。

en: Not all the students went there.
zh: 不是所有的学生都去了那儿。

en: I want all of the furniture taken to our house right away.
zh: 我想马上把所有家具都搬进我们家。

en: About one hundred and fifty dollars altogether.
zh: 总共大概一百五十美元。

en: There were only five people present altogether.
zh: 总共才到了五个人。

en: He makes most, if not all, of the important decisions for his company.
zh: 公司里绝大部分、甚至可以说是所有的重要决策都是他做的。

en: There were fifty persons in all.
zh: 总共五十个人。

en: We need twenty eggs all told.
zh: 我们一共需要二十个鸡蛋。

en: That's 150 dollars altogether.
zh: 总共一百五十美元。

en: It looks like we have everything.
zh: 看来东西都齐了。

en: Please give me the money in twenty-dollar bills.
zh: 请都给我面值二十的钞票。

en: By and large, she is a very reliable person.
zh: 总的来说，她是个非常靠谱的人。

en: By and large, this school is one of the best.
zh: 总的来说，这所学校是最好的学校之一。

en: He hasn't done badly, all in all.
zh: 总的来说，他做得还不赖。

en: The general situation is advantageous to us.
zh: 大局对咱们挺有利的。

en: The whole earth is the sepulchre of famous men.
zh: 整个地球都是名人的安息地。

en: Cut it short all over.
zh: 全都剪短一点儿。

en: Altogether, it was a success.
zh: 总的来说，这次挺成功的。

en: All in all, I thought it was a good book.
zh: 总的来说，我觉得这是本好书。

en: Overall we are on schedule.
zh: 总的来说，我们的进度没问题。

en: By and large, your idea is a good one.
zh: 大体上，你的主意挺好的。

en: On the whole, your idea is sound.
zh: 总的来看，你的想法挺靠谱的。

en: We've been fine, by and large.
zh: 总的来说，我们过得还不错。

en: A whole is made up of parts.
zh: 整体是由部分组成的。

en: The nation as a whole is in favor of political reform.
zh: 全国上下都支持政治改革。

en: Taken altogether, the President's record isn't half bad.
zh: 总的来说，总统的表现还真不赖。

en: All in all, the international conference was a success.
zh: 总的来说，这次国际会议开得很成功。

en: All in all, we had a good time at the party.
zh: 总之，我们在聚会上玩得挺开心的。

en: All in all, the excursion was pleasant.
zh: 总的来说，这次郊游挺愉快的。

en: As a whole, the plan seems to be good.
zh: 整体来看，这个计划似乎挺不错。

en: The whole village was consumed by the fire.
zh: 整个村子都被大火烧毁了。

en: I must dash or I'll be late.
zh: 我得赶紧走了，不然要迟到了。

en: Full speed ahead!

en: I never did like it anyway.
zh: 反正我从来就没喜欢过。

en: It's no trouble at all.
zh: 这一点儿都不麻烦。

en: I have no idea.
zh: 我一点儿都不知道。

en: All the players stood there with their arms folded.
zh: 球员们都双手抱胸站在那儿。

en: It is well known that up to the middle of the last century Japan was a feudal state.
zh: 众所周知，直到上个世纪中叶，日本还是个封建国家。

en: The overall output was tons.
zh: 总产量有好几吨。

en: All the world is divided into three types of people - finger-users, chopstick-users, and fork-users.
zh: 全世界的人可以分为三类：用手的、用筷子的和用叉子的。

en: The whole world hungers for peace.

en: The whole Earth was shocked.

en: The whole world was involved in the war.

en: The whole world could be destroyed by an atomic war.

en: For all mans sins damned we shall be.

en: I felt a burning sensation all over.

en: My whole body is sore.

en: I am all ears.

en: All the papers featured the case.

en: We will post the announcement in all the staff lounges.

en: The office is having a farewell party.

en: The city was alarmed by the earthquake.

en: The whole population turned out in welcome.

en: The whole nation wants peace.

en: The whole nation voted in the election.
zh: 全体国民都参加了投票。

en: The whole nation mourned the hero's death.
zh: 全国上下都在悼念英雄的去世。

en: The entire nation was glad at the news.

en: There were no signs of disorder in the ship.
zh: 船上一点儿都不乱，井然有序。

en: It is not certain if Mr Funada will join the new party.
zh: 船田先生会不会加入新党还不确定。

en: The ship touched ground.
zh: 船搁浅了。

en: The ship's captain ordered the radio operator to send a distress signal.
zh: 船长命令报务员发出求救信号。

en: The captain breathed new life into his tired crew.
zh: 船长给疲惫的船员们注入了新的活力。

en: The captain was so angry he refused to give the crew shore leave.
zh: 船长太生气了，不准船员上岸休假。

en: The captain was the last person to leave the sinking ship.
zh: 船长是最后一个离开沉船的人。

en: The captain controls the whole ship.
zh: 船长掌控着整艘船。

en: A captain controls his ship and its crew.
zh: 船长管理着整艘船和所有船员。

en: The captain is responsible for the safety of passengers.
zh: 船长负责乘客的安全。

en: The captain told us to get off the ship.
zh: 船长让我们下船。

en: The captain assured us that there would be no danger.
zh: 船长向我们保证不会有危险。

en: A captain is in charge of his ship and its crew.
zh: 船长负责管理他的船和船员。

en: Captains have responsibility for ship and crew.
zh: 船长对船只和船员负有责任。

en: How many people are on board the ship?
zh: 船上有多少人？

en: Would you please inform me of the expected shipping date?
zh: 能告诉我大概什么时候发货吗？

en: It must have been broken during shipping.
zh: 肯定是快递运送的时候弄坏了。

en: It must've been broken during shipping.
zh: 估计是寄的时候弄坏的。

en: A sailor is at sea much of the time.
zh: 水手大部分时间都在海上。

en: All the skill of the sailors gave way to the violence of the storm.
zh: 尽管水手技术很好，但还是没能扛住那场大风暴。

en: As is usual with a sailor, he likes liquor very much.
zh: 就像典型的水手一样，他特别爱喝酒。

en: He is thinking of going to sea.
zh: 他在考虑去当海员。

en: He's considering becoming a sailor.
zh: 他正打算去当个水手。

en: The men on board were surprised to see five men on the island.
zh: 船上的人看到岛上有五个人，感到很惊讶。

en: The freight on the ship got soaked.
zh: 船上的货都被泡湿了。

en: No passengers are allowed on the bridge.
zh: 乘客禁止进入驾驶台。

en: The sailors abandoned the burning ship.
zh: 水手们撤离了那艘着火的船。

en: All the skill of the sailors fell before the violence of the storm.
zh: 面对狂暴的大风，水手们的本事也使不上了。

en: The sailors were at the mercy of the weather.
zh: 水手们只能听天由命，看老天爷的脸色。

en: Abandon ship!
zh: 弃船！

en: Sailing a boat makes us happy.
zh: 航海让我们很快乐。

en: Ships and helicopters left for the spacemen's rescue.
zh: 船只和直升机都出发去营救宇航员了。

en: The ship rolled from side to side in the storm.
zh: 船在风暴中左右摇晃。

en: The ship arrived at the port on schedule.
zh: 船按时进港了。

en: The ship proceeded to her destination.
zh: 船继续驶向目的地。

en: The ship is about to sail for Manila tomorrow.
zh: 这船明天就要启程去马尼拉了。

en: The ship is arriving in harbor tomorrow morning.
zh: 船明天早上进港。

en: The boat was swallowed up in the fog.
zh: 小船消失在大雾中了。

en: The ship reached its destination in safety.
zh: 船平安抵达了目的地。

en: The boat sailed around the promontory.
zh: 船绕过了那个海岬。

en: The ship struck northward.
zh: 船向北驶去。

en: The ship was at the mercy of the wind and the waves.
zh: 船在风浪中飘摇，全看老天了。

en: The ship was locked in ice.
zh: 船被冰冻住了。

en: The ship cut her way through the waves.
zh: 船破浪前行。

en: The boat plowed the waves.
zh: 小船在波浪中穿行。

en: The ship is at the mercy of the waves.
zh: 船在波浪里任其摆布。

en: The steamer wound in and out among the islands.
zh: 轮船在岛屿间穿行。

en: The ship wound in and out among the islands.
zh: 船在岛群中绕来绕去。

en: The boat sank to the bottom.
zh: 船沉到底了。

en: The ship left ahead of time.
zh: 船提早出发了。

en: The ship performed well in the heavy storm.
zh: 船在特大风暴中表现得很好。

en: The ship made for the Pacific Ocean.
zh: 船正驶向太平洋。

en: The ship was sailing at full speed.
zh: 船在全速航行。

en: Down under the sea went the ship with all her crew.
zh: 船和全体船员都沉入了海底。

en: The ship sailed down the river.
zh: 船顺流而下。

en: The ship is sailing to the west.
zh: 船正在向西航行。

en: The ship sailed down the channel.
zh: 船顺着水道航行。

en: The ship changed its course.
zh: 船改变了航向。

en: The ship cast anchor at Kobe.
zh: 船在神户抛了锚。

en: The ship sank with all her crew on board.
zh: 船沉了，全船人员都遇难了。

en: Ships carry lifeboats so that the crew can escape.
zh: 船上都带救生艇，是为了让船员能逃生。

en: The ship set sail only to be wrecked two days after.
zh: 船刚启航，两天后就失事了。

en: The ship went off.
zh: 船开走了。

en: The ship sailed along the coast of Shikoku.
zh: 船沿着四国的海岸线航行。
